verses.text: 給五千人吃飽的神蹟這些事以後，耶穌渡過加利利海，就是提比里亞海。

words.note: Refers to a divine wonder or supernatural sign.

verses.text: 有一大群人，因為看見了他在病人身上所行的神蹟，就跟隨了他。

words.note: A grammatical particle indicating the object of a preceding verb.
Refers to divine wonders in a religious context.

verses.text: 耶穌上了山，同門徒坐在那裡。

words.note: Refers specifically to religious or spiritual followers.

verses.text: 那時猶太人的逾越節近了。

words.note: Refers to the Jewish festival commemorating the Exodus; lit. 'overpass festival'.

verses.text: 耶穌舉目觀看，見一大群人向他走過來，就對腓力說：「我們從哪裡買餅給這些人吃呢？」

words.note: A more formal or literary expression for looking up.

verses.text: 他說這話，是要試驗腓力，因他自己早已知道要怎樣作。

words.definition: to want, to be going to
to want, to be going to

verses.text: 腓力回答：「就算二百銀幣買的餅，每人分一點，也是不夠的。」

words.note: Commonly used for ancient currency.

verses.text: 有一個門徒，就是西門．彼得的弟弟安得烈，對耶穌說：

words.note: Common in religious contexts, meaning 'door follower'.

verses.text: 「這裡有個小孩子，帶著五個大麥餅、兩條魚；只是分給這麼多人，有甚麼用呢？」

words.note: Specifically barley cakes, a staple in ancient Judea.

verses.text: 耶穌吩咐他們：「你們叫眾人坐下。」原來那地方的草很多，眾人就坐下，單是男人的數目約有五千。

words.note: More formal than simply 'tell'.
Commonly refers to a large group or public.

verses.text: 耶穌拿起餅來，祝謝了，就分給坐著的人；分魚也是這樣，都是隨著他們所要的。

words.note: A formal term for giving thanks or offering a blessing.
Forms a nominal phrase with a verb, e.g., 'what they wanted'.

verses.text: 他們吃飽了之後，耶穌對門徒說：「把剩下的零碎收拾起來，免得浪費。」
門徒就把眾人吃剩那五個大麥餅的零碎收拾起來，裝滿了十二個籃子。
眾人看見耶穌所行的神蹟，就說：「這真是那要到世上來的先知。」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with a verb, indicating 'that which is done'.
Literally 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.
Literally 'one who knows first' or 'foreteller'.

verses.text: 耶穌知道群眾要來強迫他作王，就獨自又退到山上去了。
耶穌在海面上行走到了晚上，他的門徒下到海邊去。

words.note: Used as a locative particle after a noun
Lit. 'gate student'

verses.text: 他們上了船，要渡海往迦百農去。那時天已經黑了，耶穌還沒有到他們那裡。

words.note: Transliteration of Capernaum

verses.text: 忽然海上起了狂風，波浪翻騰。

words.note: Used as a locative particle after a noun

verses.text: 門徒搖櫓約行了五六公里，看見耶穌在海面上行走，漸漸靠近船，就害怕起來。

words.note: Lit. 'gate student'
Verb-object compound, specific to rowing
Used as a locative particle after a noun
Used as a verbal complement to indicate rising or the beginning of an action

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「是我，不要怕。」
他們這才把他接上船，船就立刻到了他們要去的地方。

words.note: Grammar particle for object pre-posing

verses.text: 耶穌是生命的食物第二天，站在海那邊的群眾，看見只有一隻小船留在那裡，並且知道耶穌沒有和他的門徒一同上船，門徒是自己去的；

words.note: Lit. 'gate-follower'
Verb-object compound
Lit. 'gate-follower'
Emphasizes the manner or time of action

verses.text: 不過有幾隻從提比里亞來的船停在那裡，靠近他們在主祝謝以後吃餅的地方。

words.note: Refers to Jesus or God in religious contexts

verses.text: 群眾見耶穌和門徒都不在那裡，就上船往迦百農去找耶穌。

words.note: Lit. 'gate-follower'
Verb-object compound

verses.text: 他們在對岸找到了耶穌，就問他：「拉比，你幾時到這裡來的？」

words.note: Hebrew for 'my master' or 'my teacher'
Used in 'shi...de' construction for emphasis on time/place/manner

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「我實實在在告訴你們，你們找我，不是因為看見了神蹟，而是因為吃了餅又吃飽了。

words.note: Repetitive for emphasis, often translated 'Verily, verily' in King James Version.

verses.text: 不要為那必朽壞的食物操勞，卻要為那存到永生的食物操勞，就是人子所要賜給你們的，因為人子是父 神所印證的。」

words.note: Refers to things subject to corruption or destruction.
Implies exerting oneself with effort or worry.
A title Jesus used for himself, emphasizing both humanity and divine authority.
Indicates the following verb is acted upon or done by the preceding noun.
Refers to God the Father.
Implies official endorsement or authentication, often by a seal.

verses.text: 眾人又問他：「我們應該作甚麼，才算是作 神的工作呢？」
耶穌回答：「信 神所差來的，就是作 神的工了。」

words.note: A V-C compound, 'send' with 'come' indicating the direction towards the speaker or context.
Short for 工作 (gōngzuò).

verses.text: 於是他們就說：「你要行甚麼神蹟，讓我們看了就信你呢？你到底能作甚麼呢？
我們的祖宗在曠野吃過嗎哪，正如經上所記：『他把從天上來的食物賜給他們吃。』」

words.note: The miraculous food provided to the Israelites in the wilderness.
Lit. 'above the sky/heaven'.

verses.text: 耶穌對他們說：「我實實在在告訴你們，不是摩西把那從天上來的食物賜給你們，而是我父把天上來的真食物賜給你們；

words.note: Repetition emphasizes truthfulness, common in biblical texts.
Referring to God the Father.

verses.text: 因為 神的食物就是從天上降下來，把生命賜給世人的那一位。」

words.note: The empty space before 神 is common formatting in Chinese Bibles to show reverence.

verses.text: 他們對耶穌說：「主啊，求你常把這食物賜給我們。」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我就是生命的食物，到我這裡來的，必定不餓；信我的，永遠不渴。
但我告訴你們，你們雖然見了我，還是不信。
凡是父賜給我的人，必到我這裡來；到我這裡來的，我決不丟棄他，

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Indicates strong certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 因為我從天上降下來，不是要行自己的意思，而是要行那差我來者的旨意。

words.note: Lit. 'the one who sent me to come'.

verses.text: 那差我來者的旨意就是：他所賜給我的人，我連一個也不失落，並且在末日我要使他們復活。

words.note: Indicates the following verb takes the preceding noun as its object.

verses.text: 因為我父的旨意，是要使所有看見了子而信的人有永生，並且在末日我要使他們復活。」

words.note: Refers to God the Father.
Refers to Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

verses.text: 猶太人因為耶穌說「我是從天上降下來的食物」，就紛紛議論他。

words.note: Refers to the Jewish people or inhabitants of Judea.

verses.text: 他們說：「這不是約瑟的兒子耶穌嗎？他的父母我們不都認識嗎？他現在怎麼說『我是從天上降下來的』呢？」

words.note: Indicates a rhetorical question or a seeking of clarification.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「你們不要彼此議論。
如果不是差我來的父吸引人，就沒有人能到我這裡來；到我這裡來的，在末日我要使他復活。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian contexts.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun clause ('those who come').

words.definition: the last day, end of days
words.note: Refers to the eschatological 'last day' in biblical prophecy.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual or bodily resurrection.

verses.text: 先知書上記著：『眾人都必受 神的教導。』凡聽見從父那裡來的教訓而又學習的，必到我這裡來。

words.note: Refers to the prophetic books of the Old Testament.
Indicates a continuing state of being written or recorded.
More formal or literary than '所有人'.
Indicates certainty or necessity.
Often capitalized as 　神 to denote God in Christian texts.
Literary/formal usage, often introduces a generalizing clause.
Refers to God the Father in Christian contexts.
Connects clauses, often implying a logical sequence or contrast.
Transforms the preceding phrase into a noun clause ('those who...').
Indicates certainty or necessity.

verses.text: 這不是說有人見過父；只有從 神那裡來的那一位，他才見過父。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.
位 (wèi) is a polite measure word for people.
Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，信的人有永生。

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes truth; often 'Amen, amen' in Greek.
信的人 means 'the one who believes'.

verses.text: 我就是生命的食物，
你們的祖宗在曠野吃過嗎哪，還是死了。

words.note: Commonly refers to the desert where Israelites wandered.
Transliteration of the miraculous food provided by God.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 這是從天上降下來的食物，使人吃了就不死。

words.note: Lit. 'sky above'; in biblical context, means 'from heaven'.
Directional complement indicating movement downwards towards speaker.
Indicates completion of action.

verses.text: 我就是從天上降下來生命的食物，人若吃了這食物，就必活到永遠。我要賜的食物就是我的肉，是為了世人的生命而賜的。」

words.note: Forms '為了' (wèile) meaning 'for the sake of'.
Refers to humanity as distinct from God or His chosen people.

verses.text: 於是，猶太人彼此爭論，說：「這個人怎能把他的肉給我們吃呢？」

words.note: Used to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: 耶穌就對他們說：「我實實在在告訴你們，你們若不吃人子的肉，不喝人子的血，就沒有生命在你們裡面。

words.note: A common biblical emphatic expression, often translated 'Verily, verily'.
A title Jesus used for himself, emphasizing both his humanity and messianic role.

words.definition: to not have, there is not

verses.text: 吃我肉、喝我血的，就有永生，在末日我要使他復活；

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun clause, 'the one who...'

words.definition: the last day, end of days
words.note: Refers to the eschatological 'Day of Judgment' or end times.

verses.text: 因為我的肉是真正的食物，我的血是真正的飲料。
吃我肉、喝我血的人，就住在我裡面，我也住在他裡面。

words.note: Connects verb phrase to following noun

verses.text: 正如永活的父差遣了我，我也因父活著；照樣，吃我肉的人也必因我而活。

words.note: Connects verb phrase to following noun

verses.text: 這就是從天上降下來的食物，不像嗎哪，你們的祖宗吃過，還是死了；吃這食物的，必活到永遠。」

words.note: Connects verb phrase to following noun

verses.text: 這些話是耶穌在迦百農會堂裡教導人的時候說的。
永生之道他的門徒中，有許多人聽了，就說：「這話很難，誰能接受呢？」

words.note: Literary possessive particle, often in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 耶穌心裡知道門徒為了這事議論紛紛，就對他們說：「這話使你們動搖嗎？

words.note: Describes many people discussing or murmuring in a lively or confused manner.

verses.text: 如果你們看見人子升到他原來所在的地方，又怎樣呢？

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself, emphasizing his humanity and messianic role.

verses.text: 使人活的是靈，肉體是無濟於事的。我對你們所說的話是靈、是生命。

words.note: Lit. 'no help in the matter'.

verses.text: 然而你們中間卻有不信的人。」原來從起初耶穌就知道那些不信的是誰，那要把他出賣的又是誰。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to refer to the very beginning of time or events.

verses.text: 耶穌跟著說：「所以我對你們說過，如果不是父所賜的，沒有人能到我這裡來。」

words.note: Often used for gifts from a superior or deity.

verses.text: 從此，他的門徒中有許多人退去了，不再與他同行。

words.note: Lit. 'door follower'; common in religious contexts.

verses.text: 於是耶穌對十二門徒說：「你們也想離去嗎？」
西門．彼得回答：「主啊，你有永生之道，我們還跟從誰呢？

words.note: Capitalized when referring to God/Christ.
Literary/archaic equivalent of '的'.
Can refer to 'the Word' or 'the Way' in a religious context.

verses.text: 我們已經相信，並且知道你是 神的聖者。」

words.note: Reverent space often used in Chinese Bibles before 'God'.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我不是揀選了你們十二個人嗎？但你們中間有一個是魔鬼。」

words.note: General measure word.

verses.text: 耶穌這話是指著加略人西門的兒子猶大說的，因為他雖然是十二門徒之一，卻要出賣耶穌。

words.note: Refers to Judas's origin from Karioth.
Forms a '是...的' construction, emphasizing or explaining.
Lit. 'gate follower', referring to a student or adherent.
